title: Language Communication-Based Practical Learning Program for Developing Professional Identity in Psychology Interns

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic psychological theories and counseling techniques, experience in writing professional documents and oral presentations
context.additional_context: Simulating experiences of professional identity formation in crisis situations similar to COVID-19, this course delivers practice-centered education using digital devices. Learners train to express professional identity through various communication media (voice, text, video).

learning_goals: Learners complete 80% or more of professional identity development stage tasks (self-awareness → competency integration → identity establishment) in a VR simulation environment within four weeks, with oral/written communication skills assessed at each stage.
Learners propose crisis-response strategies at least three times in work-based learning (WBL) scenarios and write reports (writing and expression) incorporating peer feedback.

At mid-program completion, learners analyze three real cases applying a provided professional ethics code (e.g., medical/legal fields) and submit a 1,500-character report. They must score 4+ (out of 5) in four of the five rubric items: clarity, logic, applicability, creativity, and format, emphasizing professional terminology and logical structuring.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
